meanings.definition: Not false or copied; genuine; real.
meanings.sent1: The antique vase was authentic, not a fake.
meanings.sent2: She wore an authentic smile, showing her true happiness.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the authentic painting in the attic, not the forgery.
meanings.sent4: His authentic kindness shone through in every action he took.
meanings.sent5: The authentic aroma of freshly baked bread filled the room.

meanings.definition: Made or done in the traditional or original way.
meanings.sent1: The recipe for the dish was authentic, passed down for generations.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman created an authentic wooden chair using only hand tools.
meanings.sent3: The play was set in an authentic medieval castle, complete with a drawbridge.
meanings.sent4: Her authentic singing style harked back to the golden age of jazz.
meanings.sent5: The authentic craftsmanship of the pottery was evident in every detail.

meanings.definition: Having the origin supported by unquestionable evidence.
meanings.sent1: The document was authentic, bearing the official seal of the king.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist discovered an authentic Roman coin at the site.
meanings.sent3: The scientist presented authentic data to support her groundbreaking theory.
meanings.sent4: His authentic alibi cleared him of any suspicion in the case.
meanings.sent5: The authentic signature on the painting confirmed its true artist.
